## What is the color of an electron?

Being a student of physics It would be stupid to think as ask what is the color of the electron is.
 But it would more stupid if I don't present my idea, the only loss I might have is I will be wrong.

![Electron Colour](data:image/jpeg;base64, "electron")

Now here is the thing, what could be the shape of an electron? Is it red or blue or any other color?.
The concept of color itself is a stupid idea. Because particles don't have color the color we
see is the color of the electromagnetic radiation emitted by the atoms.

 This process happens when a photon hits the atom so that the electron in the valence shell gets excited to the higher
energy state by absorbing the energy. But that is a very unstable state and the electron back to its original state by releasing a photon. Now what color we see depends upon the frequency of the photon the atom emitted.

![Energy Excitation](data:image/jpeg;base64, "Energy excitation")

This is how we see things, that is, we don't see the actual particles but we see radiation
emitted by them.

Now the color black is not radiation at all. It's not the color of some wave, it's just an object not
absorbing any photon so that It could have released another photon of some color. 
That object doesn't absorb or emit visible light.

![Radiation](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQWDUVcUxzSjhWkyDOjCvkyd4-icPoC0tEqkFN-6nkLpdLfWuOU4DBSrrz0_noLrwYvF0w&usqp=CAU "Radiation")

If I apply this to electron, I think that electron is of black color. 
Not only electrons but protons, neutrons, nucleic, and every subatomic particle is black.
This is what I think, what do you think ?
Thank you.
